channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2019 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Prosecutors want prison time for Felicity Huffman
item.description: Thirteen wealthy parents, including actress Felicity Huffman, and one coach will plead guilty to using bribery and other forms of fraud as part of the college admissions scandal, federal prosecutors in Boston said on Monday.

item.title: Yale rescinds student's admission in wake of scandal
item.description: Yale University has rescinded the admission of a student who was admitted as part of the ongoing college admissions scandal, the first instance of a school doing so since the scheme became public two weeks ago. CNN's Brynn Gingras reports.

item.title: 1 in 4 Japanese adults under 40 is a virgin
item.description: Japanese adults have their first heterosexual sexual experience later than their counterparts in the US and UK, according to a new study.

item.title: Trump orders firing of US Secret Service director
Donald Trump's revolving door presidency
item.description: Remember back in 2016 when then-candidate Donald Trump pledged that "I'm going to surround myself only with the best and most serious people?"

item.title: Half the women are gone from Trump's Cabinet
item.description: He's had three national security advisers, three chiefs of staff and three attorneys general and he hasn't even been in office for three years. One other result of the chaotic churn in President Donald Trump's Cabinet is that he has fewer women -- down to just three.

item.title: How Kamala Harris' death penalty decisions broke hearts on both sides
item.description: Senator Kamala Harris greets supporters along the rope line after a campaign rally. She hugs admirers, poses for selfies and warmly thanks person after person for attending.

item.title: Zhang hearing exposes Secret Service weaknesses at Mar-a-Lago
item.description: The Chinese national Yujing Zhang's hearing in a Florida federal courthouse Monday afternoon highlighted missteps by the Secret Service at virtually the same time news broke that the Secret Service director was being fired.

item.title: Rising Son: How Korea's superstar is inspiring 'Little Seoul'
She lived for 99 years with organs in all the wrong places
item.description: On an early spring day in 2018, the faint smell of formaldehyde floating in the air, 26-year-old medical student Warren Nielsen and four of his classmates prepped a cadaver in the chilly dissection lab at Oregon Health and Science University in Portland.

item.title: Wynn Resorts makes a $7B play for Australia's Crown Resorts
item.description: Wynn Resorts is placing its bets on one of Australia's largest gaming and entertainment groups.

item.title: May to ask Merkel and Macron for a Brexit extension
item.description: British Prime Minister Theresa May will meet German Chancellor Angela Merkel and French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday, as the UK leader prepares to request another Brexit extension from the European Union.

item.title: Royal baby faces US tax dilemma
item.description: As first-time parents-to-be, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have plenty to worry about already -- but thanks to the US tax system, there could be one more thing keeping Harry and Meghan and their new baby awake at night.

item.title: Alibaba faces a new challenger in online groceries
item.description: Online grocery startup Honestbee is betting a brick-and-mortar store will help it compete against tech giant Alibaba.

item.title: Wintour reveals why she wears shades
item.description: Anna Wintour, fashion's head of state and editor-in-chief of Vogue, says its time to 'stand up for what you believe in.'

item.title: Sudan is beating people up on streets. But US still seeks closer ties
Top official 'planted camera in Washington DC unisex toilet'
item.description: The highest-ranked official at New Zealand's embassy in the US planted a hidden camera in a unisex bathroom in 2017, a crown prosecutor has said in his opening address in court.

item.title: Governments are rushing to regulate the internet. Users may wind up paying the price
Trump's latest Iran decision sets a dangerous precedent
item.description: On Monday, President Donald Trump formally designated Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) as a foreign terrorist organization (FTO). This designation will do nothing to limit the IRGC's malign activities, but it may criminalize the activities of millions of Iranians and foreign tourists -- and set a precedent that Washington may come to regret.

item.title: How Israel's political debate moved from peace talks to annexation
item.description: One of the more striking campaign ads preceding Israel's upcoming elections featured footage from 2011 of Benjamin Netanyahu at the White House telling Barack Obama that the President's wish to see a restarted peace process between Israelis and Palestinians was pie-in-the-sky.

item.title: 14 tons of pangolin scales seized in Singapore
item.description: Authorities in Singapore have seized one of the largest ever shipments of pangolin scales en route to Vietnam, worth an estimated $38.7 million.

item.title: Actress pleads guilty over alleged role in sex trafficking
item.description: Actress Allison Mack has pleaded guilty to racketeering conspiracy and racketeering relating to her alleged role in a sex trafficking case.

item.title: From dream trip to nightmare abduction
item.description: It was Kimberly Sue Endicott's dream to go on an excursion to see gorillas in their natural habitat.

item.title: Sharia law fears grow in Southeast Asia
US skyscrapers kill 600 million -- yes, million -- birds every year
item.description: Around 600 million birds die every year in the United States after striking tall buildings -- with Chicago, Houston and Dallas being especially deadly, according to research from the Cornell Lab of Ornithology.

item.title: Pilots shouldn't have to battle their planes for control
item.description: For those who remember the original 1973 movie "Westworld," it can seem that the possibility of machines going rogue may be close to reality. Yul Brynner played the robot Gunslinger, who started shooting humans after being infected by some unknown computer virus and suffering a program breakdown.

item.title: CNN reporter goes on the hunt for 'torture houses'
item.description: Sudan is waging a deadly crackdown on demonstrations and dissidents. But the US is still offering closer relations.

item.title: Spectator tackles pro wrestler during WWE event
item.description: A man rushed the stage and tackled pro wrestler Bret "The Hitman" Hart as he was speaking at the WWE Hall of Fame ceremony in New York.

item.title: Mom wants answers after girl dies in school fight
item.description: Raniya Wright's mother says she told the school that her 10-year-old daughter was being bullied before the fight that resulted in her death.

item.title: 'The Walking Dead' is getting another spin-off
item.description: Yet more proof that AMC will not let its "Walking Dead" franchise die any time soon: the zombie series is getting another spin-off.

item.title: Firefighter runs half marathon with 50 pounds of gear
item.description: Running a half marathon is hard enough. But one Pennsylvania man did it while wearing 50 pounds of firefighting gear, including an oxygen tank.

item.title: Glaciers could disappear from major mountain ranges
item.description: Most glaciers in Central Europe, Western Canada and the United States would vanish in the second half of this century under the current rates of ice loss, according to a new report.

item.title: 17-foot python with 73 eggs captured
item.description: The Burmese python is one of the largest snakes in the world. But even by python standards, this one was colossal.

item.title: A child died after a school fight. Her mom is demanding answers
item.description: The mother of Raniya Wright, the Walterboro, South Carolina, girl who died after a classroom fight, says Raniya's friends told her that a bully had been baiting the 10-year-old into a fight and caused her to hit her head on a bookshelf before she died.

item.title: R. Kelly's first post-jail performance lasted all of 28 seconds
item.description: R. Kelly has given his first performance since getting out of jail and reportedly it was brief.

item.title: Is this sofa-style seat the future of business class air travel?
item.description: On a long-haul flight, passengers spend the time working, eating, sleeping, relaxing -- and all in the same seat.

item.title: Is this ultra-fast rocket engine the heir to the Concorde?
item.description: Fans of supersonic flight have been yearning for a new way to break the sound barrier ever since Concorde stopped flying in 2003.

item.title: Goats are the latest weapons in the war against wildfire
item.description: "We are living in a tinderbox," says Reinette Senum.

item.title: Netflix teases Beyoncé documentary
item.description: It looks like a Beyoncé documentary may be dropping on Netflix next week.

item.title: The best European sleeper trains
item.description: As the train pulls out of the station, you slowly drift off to sleep. Several hours later, you wake up in another country, exciting new scenes speeding past the windows.

item.title: Rugby star closes in on NFL dream
item.description: Former English rugby star Christian Wade's dream of making it big in the NFL moved a step closer Monday after he joined the Buffalo Bills, the NFL side confirmed.

item.title: 28-year-old golfer dies in hotel room
Animal activists storm slaughterhouses
item.description: Dozens of animal rights activists were arrested as coordinated protests brought one of Australia's biggest cities to a brief standstill Monday amid calls for sweeping changes to the country's meat industry.

item.title: Obama jokes about Michelle leaving him
item.description: Former President Obama throws light jabs at politicians in the US while speaking to a crowd in Berlin.

item.title: Felicity Huffman issues apology over college admissions case
item.description: Felicity Huffman has apologized for her part in a college admissions scam.

item.title: Watch: Actress says she doesn't push her kids in old interview
item.description: CNN's Randi Kaye reports on Lori Loughlin and Felicity Huffman's past remarks on parenting and their daughters before the college admissions scam fallout.

item.title: Stanford expels student linked to $500,000 donation
item.description: Stanford University expelled a student who put false material in their college application and was linked to a $500,000 donation from the charity at the heart of the college admissions scam.

item.title: Trump overseeing 'near-systematic purge'
item.description: White House senior adviser Stephen Miller wants to make sure that outgoing Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen is only the first of a string of senior officials headed out the door.

item.title: Evidence suggests woman accused of illegal entry to Mar-a-Lago was trying to spy on US
item.description: Yujing Zhang, the woman who allegedly breached security at President Donald Trump's private Florida club while carrying Chinese passports and a flash drive containing malware late last month, had a signal detector, other electronic devices and thousands of dollars in cash in her hotel room, federal prosecutors said Monday.

item.title: Trump: Iran military force are terrorists
item.description: President Donald Trump announced Monday the US will formally designate Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps as a Foreign Terrorist Organization.
